title: Florence Fishing | Oregon Fishing Forum
text: This article will serve as your ultimate guide to fishing in Florence, providing detailed information on the best spots, the types of fish you can catch, tips for a successful trip, and much more. Florence, located on the scenic Oregon coast, is a hidden gem for fishing enthusiasts. The town is nestled between the Pacific Ocean and the Siuslaw River, providing a diverse range of fishing environments. The area's lush forests, pristine lakes, and winding rivers make it a paradise for anglers. With easy access to freshwater and saltwater fishing, Florence attracts anglers from all over the Pacific Northwest and beyond. Florence offers several prime fishing locations, each with its own unique appeal. Whether you prefer river fishing, lake fishing, or heading out to the ocean, you'll find the perfect spot here. The Siuslaw River is one of the most popular fishing destinations in Florence. Flowing from the Coastal Range to the Pacific Ocean, the river is renowned for its Chinook salmon runs. Anglers can also find steelhead and cutthroat trout in these waters. The best times to fish here are during the spring and fall salmon runs, where the river teems with activity. Siltcoos Lake, the largest lake on the Oregon coast, offers excellent fishing opportunities. It's a fantastic spot for catching largemouth bass, which thrive in its warm, shallow waters. The lake is also home to other species such as perch and bluegill. The surrounding scenery, with its lush vegetation and abundant wildlife, makes fishing here a tranquil experience. Woahink Lake is another top spot for freshwater fishing in Florence. Known for its clear waters, it's a great place to catch rainbow trout and largemouth bass. The lake is stocked regularly, ensuring that there's always plenty of fish to catch. Kayaking or using a small boat is ideal for reaching the best fishing spots on the lake. For those looking to fish in the open sea, Florence offers access to some of the best ocean fishing on the Oregon coast. Charter boats are available to take you out for deep-sea fishing, where you can catch halibut, rockfish, lingcod, and Dungeness crab. The experience of fishing in the vast Pacific Ocean, with the chance to reel in some sizable fish, is unmatched. Florence’s diverse waters are home to a wide variety of fish species. Depending on where and when you fish, you can catch anything from salmon to bass. Chinook salmon, also known as king salmon, are one of the most prized catches in Florence. These powerful fish are most abundant during the spring and fall runs in the Siuslaw River. Chinook salmon are known for their size and fight, making them a favorite among sport anglers. Steelhead are another popular target in Florence. These sea-run rainbow trout are known for their strength and acrobatics when hooked. They are typically found in the Siuslaw River during the winter and summer runs. Steelhead fishing requires skill and patience, but the reward is well worth the effort. Rainbow trout are commonly found in Florence’s lakes, particularly in Woahink Lake and Siltcoos Lake. These fish are stocked regularly, making them accessible to anglers of all skill levels. Rainbow trout are known for their vibrant colors and delicious taste. Largemouth bass are abundant in Siltcoos and Woahink Lakes. These fish are known for their aggressive behavior and are a favorite among freshwater anglers. Bass fishing in Florence is particularly good in the warmer months, when the fish are most active. While not a fish, Dungeness crab is a highly sought-after catch in the waters off Florence. Crabbing is a popular activity in the region, especially during the fall and winter months. Dungeness crab are known for their sweet, tender meat and are a prized delicacy on the Oregon coast. The fishing season in Florence varies depending on the species and location. Here's a breakdown of what you can expect throughout the year. Spring is an excellent time for Chinook salmon fishing in the Siuslaw River. The river comes alive with the spring salmon run, drawing anglers from near and far. This is also a good time for bass fishing in the lakes as the water warms up. Summer offers diverse fishing opportunities in Florence. You can fish for steelhead in the Siuslaw River, bass in the lakes, and head out to the ocean for deep-sea fishing. The warm weather makes it an ideal time for spending long days on the water. Fall is another prime time for salmon fishing, particularly the fall Chinook run in the Siuslaw River. The cooler weather also makes it a great time for crabbing along the coast. The fall colors and crisp air add to the experience, making it a favorite season for many anglers. Winter is the peak season for steelhead fishing in the Siuslaw River. Despite the colder temperatures, dedicated anglers flock to the river to try their luck. Winter is also a good time for crabbing and fishing for bottom-dwelling species like lingcod in the ocean. Before you head out to fish in Florence, it's important to familiarize yourself with the local fishing regulations. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife (ODFW) sets rules to ensure sustainable fishing practices. The fishing techniques you use in Florence will depend on the type of fish you're targeting and the location. Fly fishing is a popular method for catching steelhead and trout in the Siuslaw River and local lakes. This technique requires specialized equipment, including a fly rod, reel, and flies that mimic local insect life. Fly fishing is an art form that takes practice, but it can be incredibly rewarding. Trolling is commonly used in the Siuslaw River for catching salmon. This involves slowly dragging lures or baited lines behind a moving boat. The movement of the boat helps cover a large area, increasing your chances of a bite. Shore fishing is an accessible option for those without a boat. You can fish from the banks of the Siuslaw River, the shores of the lakes, or even from the beach along the coast. Shore fishing is ideal for targeting species like bass, trout, and surfperch. If you're new to fishing or want to maximize your chances of success, consider booking a fishing charter or guided tour in Florence. Experienced guides can take you to the best spots, provide all the necessary gear, and share their local knowledge. Popular charters in the area offer deep-sea fishing trips, river fishing tours, and crabbing excursions. If you're new to fishing, Florence is a great place to start. Several tackle shops in Florence offer a wide range of fishing gear, bait, and supplies. They can also provide valuable local advice on where to fish and what techniques to use. If you don't have your own boat, there are rental options available in Florence. You can rent everything from kayaks and canoes for lake fishing to motorboats for river and ocean fishing. For those looking to stay overnight, Florence has numerous campgrounds, RV parks, and lodges. Many are located close to prime fishing spots, making it easy to get an early start on your fishing day. Florence is committed to preserving its natural resources, and anglers play a key role in these efforts. Fishing is a great activity for families, and Florence offers plenty of opportunities for a fun, educational experience. Many local lakes, such as Siltcoos Lake, have easy access points and calm waters, making them ideal for kids. Teaching children to fish not only introduces them to the joys of the sport but also instills a respect for nature. Florence hosts several fishing competitions and events throughout the year. These events are a great way to test your skills, meet other anglers, and enjoy the camaraderie of the fishing community. Some popular events include the annual salmon derby on the Siuslaw River and the bass fishing tournaments on Siltcoos Lake. One of the best ways to learn about fishing in Florence is by talking to the locals. Many have spent their entire lives fishing these waters and have stories and tips to share. Whether it's advice on the best fishing spots or tales of the one that got away, you'll find that the local fishing community in Florence is welcoming and full of knowledge. Fishing in Florence, Oregon, is more than just a pastime—it's a way to connect with nature, relax, and enjoy the beautiful coastal scenery. Whether you're after the thrill of catching a massive Chinook salmon or simply enjoying a peaceful day on the lake with your family, Florence has something to offer every angler. With its rich variety of fish, diverse fishing environments, and welcoming community, Florence is a fishing destination that will leave you with unforgettable memories. So pack your gear, head to Florence, and cast your line into the waters of this stunning Oregon coast town. Whether you’re a seasoned angler or a beginner, you’re sure to find fishing in Florence an experience like no other.
